characters: AN AEROPLANE ROARS THROUGH THE BLUE SKY. 23

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: ...British, fifties, a melodrama. We're looking at an ACTRESS - glamorous, young - but very much in the back ground of the scene - a secretary typing at her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG BOY sits watching the film, his clothes and the room around him telling us this is England in the 1960s. is staring raptly at the actress.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All my life I've been a Looky- Loo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are CLOSE on an extremely handsome YOUNG MAN staring past us with a dazzling smile.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My name's Sidney Young. I'm a journalist...a hack. (Beat) Yeah, that...that isn't me. We PAN right and down to our hero - SIDNEY YOUNG - thirties, an odd-ball with a knack for getting people to dislike him.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is me at the Golden Globe Awards in L.A. this year. That's my Armani tuxedo. That's a Rolex Sea-Dweller 4000 watch I'm wearing. Still in SLOW-MOTION we TRACK BACK and see that Sidney is at a table with several other people, all staring raptly past us to the stage which is out of shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those people all around me - they're all famous. They're my friends. Beside him sits a beautiful young woman - SOPHIE MAES (20's). 2.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's the actress Sophie Maes. This morning she told me she would let me have sex with her if she won the Best Actress Award. Still in SLOW MOTION, Sophie suddenly covers her face wit her hands and begins to stand.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She just won the Best Actress Award. Sophie walks out of the shot. Still sporting the fixed smile, Sidney claps in SLO-MO along with everyone else in the room. We TRACK away from Sidney past tables of CELEBRITIES towards an EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life didn't used to be like this. We PUSH THROUGH the EXIT DOORS and find ourselves impossibly looking at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a crowd of FANS held back from us by a red rope, crani their necks to see us more clearly, waving, cheering, shouting, cameras flashing... Rain lashes down. A CAPTION reads: "Sidney's Life, One Year Ago. Bafta Awards. London."

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Looky-Loos. That's what They call you when you stand out in the rain all night just to catch a glimpse of Them going by. REVERSE - CELEBRITIES walk down the red carpet, pausing t wave at the fans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to pretend it was different for me because I was getting paid by a magazine or newspaper, whatever. But that's, you know...I just loved watching Them. I'd stand outside looking in through the window and think what it would be like to somehow get inside. But there was only one way to get past the thin red line that separates the celebrities from the civilians. You had to be famous. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney stands talking to a young PR WOMAN at the security gate. He has a small, ugly PIG on a leash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babe Three. Yeah. She looks doubtfully at the pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babe was a cute little piglet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry Potter used to be a cute little piglet too. What do you want? Tempus Fugits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't got any ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many pigs are coming tonight? Look, I was told to bring him, hand him over to the producer, Bob Milton, inside. You want me  to leave him here with you, that's fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you can't leave him with me. I've got...Hold on, I'll... She looks around, helplessly. She begins to unhook the re rope. Sidney tries to hide his excitement.

dialogues.speaker: PR WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you're positive that you're supposed to... An OLDER PR WOMAN stalks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well, Sidney Young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well...clipboard Nazi-type woman. She turns to the SECURITY standing beside them.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER PR WOMAN
dialogues.text: The pig doesn't get in. 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER PR WOMAN
dialogues.text: I was talking about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney and the Pig are being "escorted" away from the red carpet by the Security.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Looky-Loos dream is that one day they will somehow get to mingle with the stars. But the Industry can't allow any mingling. Stars have to be kept away from civilians, have to be quarantined, so they don't become normal. Like us. They pass a ravishing HOLLYWOOD ACTRESS walking the other way. She looks curiously at the pig as she passes. Sidney stares after her, longingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING through the doors and into the lobby of the exclusive hotel.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But after the awards come the parties - the Miramax Party, the London Records Party and, best of all - the Sharps Magazine Party, so exclusive that there are no pass-alongs, no plus-ones, no press. We find Sidney checking in at the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Receptionist,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much? I only want to stay for one night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney stands in the rising elevator, suit bag in his han holdall at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where the movie stars can finally relax, secure in the knowledge they are among their own kind. We see the PIG'S SNOUT poking out of the zip of the holdall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney turns from the mirror to face us. He is wearing a WAITER'S UNIFORM of white shirt, waistcoat, and bow tie. is also wearing a WIG and FALSE MOUSTACHE.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And that is when I strike. He picks up a tray of canapГ©s from the bed and looks dow to where the Pig watches him from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you in bed by ten. And no porn. He tosses the pig one of the canapГ©s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, tray in hand, peers around the corner to the entrance to the hotel's roofed COURTYARD. The Older PR Woman we saw earlier stands at the door, a formidable presence. As we watch she greets an approaching CELEBRITY gushingly. Seizing his chance Sidney darts towards the do and, tray held aloft to cover his face, slips through int the courtyard beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as Sidney emerges from the washrooms, now dressed only in the white shirt and black trousers. He scoops up a passing glass of champagne, checks his moustache and surveys the courtyard - a room full of glamour: tanned skin, diamonds, beautiful dresses, beautiful suits, champagne. He stands surveying the crowd of A-list celebrities in front of him, dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do this. You belong here. You're a star. You're a big, bright shining star... 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is trashed - furniture over-turned, mini-bar ope and broken bottles all over the floor. A weird squealing which could almost be human is coming from the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT MANAGER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello? Sir? The squealing stops.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT MANAGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is everything alright? The door opens and the Assistant Manager walks in and stands staring around him in horror. Behind him the pig emerges from the bathroom and slips out of the open door, across the corridor and straight into the open lift...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is talking to a very famous and very drunk Hollywo ACTRESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, when I'm in L.A. I stay at the Sunset Marquis, when I'm here I always stay at the Sanderson. It's, you know, I don't feel at home these days unless I'm in a hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm a writer. Movie writer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Got one in pre-production now. You know it's really weird running into you like this because just the other day I was telling the producer I thought you'd be perfect for the lead. She starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, seriously, you would, because, you know, you have this mixture of intelligence and beauty and fragility that we're looking for and, uh... 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the film?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tits of Fury. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm joking, I'm just...It's a bio- pic. About Greta Garbo. That's why I thought of you. You have those amazing cheek-bones and...are they real? Have you had plastic surgery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? No, hardly anything. A penis reduction as a child, that's pretty much... She laughs again, snorting into her drink. Sidney can't believe this - she likes him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lift doors glide open and the Pig trots out and aroun the corner. The PR Woman is still at the door to the courtyard, berating one of her staff. The Pig sails past them both, unnoticed, and disappears into the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG MAN sits drinking at a table. He slips a little b of Ecstasy from his pocket and takes one.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE TABLE
dialogues.text: As the Young Man pushes the bag back into his pocket. The Pig sits at his feet watching as the little bag slips bac out and DROPS to the floor. The Pig sniffs at the bag...

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY AND HOLLYWOOD ACTRESS 15
dialogues.text: ...still talking. The place is crammed now, and hot. Sidn wipes sweat from his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, I'm drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you? 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so drunk. I haven't eaten and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel okay? Because my room's just upstairs if you want to lie down or, or loosen any, you know, morals or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your name again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark. Clark Baxter. He takes a sip of his champagne and his moustache comes loose and hangs limply from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do? The Actress stares at him in surprise but Sidney doesn't notice - he is staring past her to where there is somethi of a COMMOTION amongst the guests. The PR Woman is hurryi across the room, hissing into her ear-piece. Somebody screams. Then to Sidney's horror a group of guests scatte in panic and the cause of the commotion is revealed: the Pig charges into view, heading straight for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit... The Pig suddenly skids to a halt and stares at Sidney wit hot eyes. The PR Woman follows the Pig's gaze and spots Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, get security! Code Red. Sidney Young got in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Sidney Young? Before Sidney can answer the Pig charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! Sidney turns and legs it.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: We are looking OVER THE SHOULDER of a tall grey-haired MA who stands in the shadows watching Sidney run past. This CLAYTON HARDING, his face hidden for the time being. 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lights a cigarette with a thoughtful air and watches Sidney's flight, rolling the BOOK OF MATCHES between his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH SIDNEY
dialogues.text: ...as the Pig catches up with him and lunges at his ankle Sidney screams, trips and flies through the air, wig spinning free, hurtling straight towards a table of startled celebrities. We FREEZE FRAME. SUPERED TITLE - "How To Lose Friends & Alienate Peopl We hear the opening of David Bowie's Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the TITLES and song continue we see a protesting Sidne and Pig being escorted by Security through the endless corridors of the Hotel. Titles End. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A seedy flat in Shepherds bush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney lies in bed reading a newspaper in his underwear. phone is RINGING in the next room. Sidney begins to cut out a photograph from one of the papers - Sidney struggling with an irate Clint Eastwood a some Security Men. The phone continues to ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you get that? (Beat) Will you get the phone? Sighing he gets up and scratching himself, stumbles throu to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...which we see is, bizarrely, an OFFICE - full of an odd assortment of JOURNALISTS, desks, antiquated computers an an old fax machine. The walls are lined with past covers from Sidney's magazine - The Post-Modern Review. One bear a photograph of Victoria Beckham with the title "Posh Spice? Like Fuck She Is." 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JOURNALIST is talking on the phone by the door. The oth phone is still ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we don't hate celebrities at the Post-Modern Review, okay? We just don't think they should be taking themselves so seriously. For us a celebrity is a text to be deconstructed. Apart from Costner obviously. Sidney edges past him to where a LARGE WOMAN and a histrionic THIN MAN are in the middle of a argument, encouraged by the other members of staff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do this the honour of calling it a review. It's a puerile, personal attack in, in alcoholic prose, in which incidentally you manage to misquote both Derrida and Lyotard. I am a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...an internationally respected academic and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...author of a very well received book on the history of culture and a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckwit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (threading his way past) Couldn't one of you answer the phone? As the argument continues behind him he reaches the phone with a bored YOUNG MAN sitting by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you answer that? What do I pay you for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't pay me. 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get the phone! The Young Man answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Post-Modern Review.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, if she doesn't apologise I'm quitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Large Woman) George can't leave. You'll have to apologise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't George leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He owns the fax machine. Sidney notices the Young Man is staring at him with a scared expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Sharps Magazine. Sidney stops smiling.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sue, we're finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. (To the others) Will you be quiet! They ignore him and continue bickering. Sidney picks up t phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney Young.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (over phone, gravel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Clayton Harding. I'm the editor of Sharps Magazine. Sidney is visibly thrown. 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Lord Vader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOTING FROM BEHIND Clayton Harding's swivel chair - all we can see is Clayton's grey hair, his custom-built desk and the enormous office in front of him. He is smoking. A he talks he rolls a BOOK OF MATCHES between his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you at my party, just before you ruined it with your little pig stunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You liked that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. On his desk we see a few copies the Post-Modern Review - glimpses of stars on the covers - Catherine Zeta-Jones, Orlando Bloom... Clayton's hand sifts one copy from the others and holds it up - the cover depicts CLAYTON HIMSEL patrician handsome, stern, photo-shopped so that he appea to be NAKED. A headline reads "Clayton Harding - The Editor's New Clothes? Clayton's shoulder's heave with a snort of repressed laughter.

dialogues.speaker: CLAYTON HARDING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (examining the cover) I especially liked the part where Clint Eastwood beat the shit outa ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney lights a cigarette, trying to seem casual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not scared of you, Harding. You want to sue, go ahead and sue. It's like Jimmy Stewart said, (a poor Stewart impersonation:)"You sit up there and you spin your little webs and you think the whole world revolves around you and your money. Well, it doesn't, Mr... Mr... 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clayton is still flicking through the magazines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mr. Potter..."You go ahead and sue if you want, but I warn you, if you strike me down, I shall become more powerful than you can possibly imagine. An ASSISTANT walks in. Clayton looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Taylor is here sir. Clayton nods and quickly throws the magazines into a BOTT DRAWER of the desk. Sidney is still talking over the phon beginning to enjoy himself.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Destroy me and a hundred more will spring up in my place - men who care nothing for success, men who cannot be bought, men whose only loyalty is to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to come and work for me at Sharps Magazine in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney stares to where the Thin Man is trying to get out the door with the Fax Machine, the Large Woman struggling with him. The two fall to the floor. The rest of the staf gather around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight, fight, fight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...could you say that again please? We hear the sound of an aeroplane engine build as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney emerges from the airport, wearing his crumpled bro suit, dragging his suitcase behind him. He stares around, excited to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney drags his suitcase down the quiet street and stops outside an apartment block, checking the address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elderly Polish lady - MRS KOWALSKI - is leading Sidney up the stairs of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This magazine you are working for? It is good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Sharps Magazine. You know Sharps? It's sort of society, fashion, crime, finance, Hollywood celebrities...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollywood. Sodom and Gomorrah. Now everybody is celebrity. You take out your breasts, you are celebrity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing her chest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think it depends on the breasts but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Poland, someone was famous because they had done something...Marie Curie...Pope John Paul...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they don't make entertainers like that any more... Mrs Kowalski cuffs the back of his head. Sidney is somewh surprised by this familiarity, having only just met the lady. She opens an apartment door.  15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs Kowalski shows Sidney into the small and cheaply furnished apartment. Sidney's boxed possessions stand in corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They brought your things yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup, this is good. This is...I can put my drum kit just over there and, uh... She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a...that's just a joke. They're just little...congas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do you start work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you need to be fresh, make a good impression.(Leaving) Go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what I'm going to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drunken Sidney dances frenetically on a small dance flo made of squares of flashing color, compensating with enthusiasm for what he lacks in coordination. The women o the floor shuffle further and further away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney walks down the street, staring bright eyed at the city around him, in love with New York. A SEXY WOMAN in a short dress passes him. Sidney ogles her as she walks int a BAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney finds the Sexy Woman sitting at the bar. There is empty stool beside her. Sidney sidles into it. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Kona please. Sidney gestures to the Barman to make it two. He sits trying to think of something to say. The barman returns with their drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising his glass) Hi, my name's Clark. Clark Baxter. The Woman looks at him without expression. Sidney sips hi drink, grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a water sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's...that's not right, is it? That's not...put a dash of beer in that. A young woman has been sitting on the other side of Sidne This is ALISON OLSEN (20s) smart, attractive, dressed in elegant but no-nonsense suit. She is writing in a NOTEBOO She looks up and notices Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, my boyfriend's sitting there. Sidney gets up and examines the stool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he? He's fucking small isn't he? He smiles at the Sexy Woman, hoping to get a laugh. Aliso examines Sidney coolly, points to the drink on the bar in front of Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his White Russian. He'll be here in a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you reserve these seats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Sidney sits down and turns back to the Sexy Woman. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a journalist. Work for a little periodical you might have heard of called Sharps Magazine? Sidney produces a card and waves it vaguely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the Cultural Editor. Alison takes the card from his hand before he can put it away again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sexy Woman) This is a library card. (Reading it) From Glow-cester...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snatching it back) That's...not that one... (Searching wallet) I've got it somewhere...I just... The Sexy Woman gets up and walks away. Sidney watches her go bitterly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just doing my bit for the gene pool. He produces the PHOTOGRAPH of him being held in a headloc by Clint Eastwood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that there with Clint Eastwood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan Freeman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, in the headlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had this laminated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh just give it... He snatches the photograph back, catching Alison's glass the process. Her drink SPILLS over her notebook - soaking the page she has been writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's okay. I've got it. He tries to blot the page with a napkin, smearing the ink

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just...just leave it! She examines the book, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. He tries to think of something to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pronounced Gloucester by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to get off that seat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know the meaning of Karma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inscribing a circle in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What goes around, comes around. The moment is approaching when you will pay the price for being an asshole. When my boyfriend gets here I'm going to put my pacifist leanings to one side and encourage him to take you outside and... Her cell-phone rings. She answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Hi, honey.(Beat) Oh. (Beat) no, no, it's...don't worry about it. I'll see you then. She hangs up, avoiding Sidney's gaze, embarrassed and annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyfriend not coming? 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares straight ahead, gathering her things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm sorry. Do you think...? She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I could have his drink? Alison gives him a cold smile, controlling her temper. Sh spots a heavily made-up WOMAN walking past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobbie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a seat? I'm just leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. The Woman takes Alison's place at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the newcomer) Hello. He slides the PHOTOGRAPH over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess who that is with Clint Eastwood. Alison gives a small smile and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney and the Woman dance drunkenly around the room to t music blaring from Sidney's stereo. The track finishes an they stand gasping for breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna powder my nose. Why don't you put on something a little more romantic? She staggers off down the hall. Sidney, giddy with excitement, searches through some LPs and puts one on his old turntable. It's Ace of Spades by Motorhead. He stagge around, playing air-guitar for a moment. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music is suddenly switched off. He turns to find Mrs Kowalski standing beside the record player, staring griml at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs Lebowski...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kowalski. You know what time it is? The music blaring, your door open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to seem sober) Was it? Fuck. I mean, shit. Sorry. I just...met an old friend and brought them back... The Woman staggers back into the room, her back to us. Sh is NAKED. She is also surprisingly muscular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...for a little... He notices the woman. His gaze drops to below the waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...penis. Mrs Kowalski turns and takes in the view. Nobody moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hung-over Sidney wakes up in his bed, light streaming through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He examines his reflection, psyching himself up for his first day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do this! You can do this! He hums the fanfare from the Rocky theme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney walks into the room, still humming the theme tune, shadow boxing. He opens the blinds and turns to the couch The "Woman" wakes up from where she has been sleeping on the couch and gazes blearily at Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick coffee Bob and then you've got to go. 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the opening of Brian Ferry's version of The `In' Crowd as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the song continues we see Sidney swagger down the busy sidewalk towards us. He is wearing sunglasses and a T-shi emblazoned with a photograph of Keanu Reeves and the caption "Young, Dumb and Full of Cum."The T-shirt is ridi up a little over his belly.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is my city. He stops at a gleaming chrome entrance and stares up at t Heywood Building towering above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the song continues Sidney, still swaggering, is escort through the formidable looking security by a thin and chi ASSISTANT. The entrance hall arches above them, a vast an impressive cavern of chrome and glass.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is my building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney leans nonchalantly against the wall of the lift examining the Chic Assistant and two stunningly beautiful MODELS who are in conversation. Sidney manages to catch t attention of one of the models and flashes what he believ is a rakish smile. In return he receives an icy glare.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: These are my models.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chic Assistant leads Sidney down a curving, red carpeted corridor, past a chrome wall inscribed with the giant logo of the magazine. They reach a set of double doors which the Assistant opens for Sidney...

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And this... Sidney walks through into...

dialogues.speaker: CLAYTON HARDING'S OFFICE 38
dialogues.text: Harding swings around in his chair to glare at us, a cigarette in his mouth. 22.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...is my Boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you wearing? The song grinds to an abrupt halt. Sidney loses a quantit of swagger. He examines his T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it? I brought you one. He takes a T-shirt from his satchel and hands it to Harding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Casually he flings the shirt out of the open window behin him.

dialogues.speaker: CLAYTON HARDING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Next time you come here dressed like that, you follow the shirt. You understand? Sidney nods dumbly.

dialogues.speaker: CLAYTON HARDING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sit down. How was the flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Thanks for the business class tickets, Clay. Harding regards him gravely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a mistake. And don't call me Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, if it's any consolation I got downgraded anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is some consolation. Sidney notices that the copy of The Post-Modern Review is on the desk - Clayton NAKED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! That was just a little, uh... as it happens I'm a big fan of your earlier, funnier work. Snipe Magazine that was...that was really good. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harding stares at Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you've...you've actually been a big influence on me and I really think together we can inject a bit of that Snipe spirit into this magazine. Now I've got a few ideas that I'd like to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you've arrived, doncha? Well I hate to break it to you, but you're only in the first room. It's not nothing, don't get me wrong, but there are plenty of people in this town who never made it past the first room. After a year or so, maybe longer, you'll discover a secret doorway at the back of the first room that leads to the second. Eventually, if you're lucky, you'll discover another doorway back of the second room that leads to the third. He gazes at Sidney through narrowed eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CLAYTON HARDING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There are seven rooms in all. You're in the first, I'm in the seventh, and doncha forget it Sidney has been listening with a frown of concentration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...if I make it to the Seventh Room - will I become a true Jedi Knight? Harding exhales smoke and puts out his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which brings us to the subject of your sense of humour. I had a look through your "magazine" here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you think? Clayton swivels in his chair and stares thoughtfully out over the Manhattan skyline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I thought it was...kinda snarky. And bitter. And... witless. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney digests this. Clayton seems lost in thought. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: CLAYTON HARDING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to try you out in the I Spy Section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is hurrying to keep up with LAWRENCE MADDOX (40's) as he strides down the corridor. Lawrence is Canadian, handsome, one of the golden boys of the magazine and arrogant with it. Other EMPLOYEES pass them as they walk, heads down, expressions serious. The place is a model of quiet, professional industry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at Sidney's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Sidney. We've only just met but already I perceive I am in the presence of a rare comic sensibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know your Hi-jinx gave you a certain notoriety back in Olde England but things are going to be a bit different here. Harding wants me to be your Rabbi, show you the ropes. Are you aware of what we do at I Spy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You photograph famous people when they're drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I Spy is the nation's window onto High Society. The Looky-Loos read us because...well, They Weren't There. The Glitterati read us because we tell them They Were There. For this system to work we have to know where There is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...when we go out to clubs and things...would that, would that be on expenses or...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a vacation. It's a vocation. 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maddox sweeps around the corner into an open-plan office area. Fact-checkers and Assistants buzz around.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE MADDOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When we do go out you're going to have to wear something more suitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. What do you mean by suitable? Maddox gestures at Sidney's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something that covers all of this up. He starts to check messages on his desk. Sidney, trying t seem at ease, stares at a black and white PHOTOGRAPH on t wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Mussolini?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat.) ) No, Sidney, that's Richard Heywood. The owner of this magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Looks a little like, uh...(pointing to the child in the photograph, smiling) Who's this funny looking kid? Is that his son? Maddox stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his daughter, Elizabeth; now my wife. A SUBTITLE materializes like a halo around Maddox's head. It reads: Do Not Fuck with Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Well, she's very...isn't she? Really, very... Someone walks up behind Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Olsen here takes care of the gallery openings, book launches and other intellectual fare. Can you find our new rookie something to do? 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney turns to find Alison behind him, eating an apple. She eyes him coldly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear the Cultural Editor's job is up for grabs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison sits working at her computer. Sidney appears and perches on the edge of her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, seeing as how I'm going to be sitting just over there, don't you think we should try and put last night behind us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Get off my desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure what I'm supposed to be doing. (Beat) Are you going to help me out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Which way did you come in? Sidney stares at her. Alison takes some contact sheets fr her desk and shoves them at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris Blick exhibition opening. Caption it. Now get off my desk. One of the magazines gorgeous Fashionistas - INGRID - wal past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Ingrid. Ingrid stares at Sidney's outfit, thrown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a wolfish smile) You going to introduce me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Clark Baxter. (Noticing Ingrid's gaze) He's English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (That explains it) Ohh...right. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually it's Sidney. Sidney Young. Clark Baxter is my alias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you have an alias?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He uses it when he's trying to pick up transsexuals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. She walks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it you knew about Bob and didn't tell me? Alison inscribes a circle in the air with her finger without looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is on the phone. He is staring at some contact sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, is that the Parsons Gallery?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. This is Celia Parsons speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Sidney Young from Sharps Magazine? We're running some photographs from your opening of the Chris Blick exhibition, and I just need to caption them. I was wondering if you could help me identify some of the people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. So...Chris Blick. Man or woman?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What? 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Chris Blick a man or woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're calling from Sharps magazine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me Stanley, why have they given you this assignment if you don't know who one of the most famous artists in America is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I don't really know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Is he an old man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an older man, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I've got two old men here - so is he the fat one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do realize that Clayton Harding is a personal friend of mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that got to do with anything?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Right. She hangs up. Beat. Sidney looks around, hoping no-one wa listening. He re-dials.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Parsons gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he the one with the wonky eye? 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, coming back from lunch, gets into the lift eating HAMBURGER. Another of the magazine's Fashionistas - ANNA gets into the lift and tries to hold the door open for an approaching friend. The doors swish shut, Anna pulling he hand out of the way just in time. The lift rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fashion sensitive. If you're not wearing Prada it'll take your arm clean off. Anna stares at this strange man with the burger, baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am wearing Prada. The lift stops and she gets out. Alison gets in, sees Sidney and winces. She takes out a book and pretends to read. The lift begins to rise again. Through it's glass doors we see the different floors passing, different publications - each a hive of sober, hard work. Sidney stares at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't what I expected. Alison recoils slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you expect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. The Algonquin circle. Dorothy Parker. Martinis. Quips. Look at them. Not one of them is drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called being a professional. You should try it some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something you should understand. I'm not really one of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By "you" do you mean "human?" 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean the glossy posse. Bunch of Zombies, writing about "Pets of the Stars" but acting like they're working for the UN. I'm here to shake things up a bit. Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that it's any of your business, but I'm from Port Huron, Michigan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Small town girl. (Hannibal Lector impersonation) I bet you could only dream of getting out. Getting anywhere - yes, Clarice? Getting all the way - to the N...Y...C. (Dropping the impersonation) Take my advice, don't go taking this celebrity fluff seriously. For a moment Alison is speechless with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...you...arrogant... The lift stops and a TALL WOMAN enters. She is expensivel dressed, wears Chanel dark glasses, an expression of granite and an air of superhuman froideur. Alison exchanges the slightest of nods with her and stare tensely ahead. Only Sidney, busy chewing, is oblivious to the plunge in temperature. For a moment there is only the soft whir of the lift. The Sidney begins to choke on some burger. He wheezes for a moment, gagging. The Woman stiffens slightly but shows no other sign of having noticed the revolting noises coming from behind he Alison closes her eyes. Sidney gives a violent cough and a chunk of chewed burger and coleslaw flies out of his mouth and lands on the back of the oblivious Woman's Prada jacket. Sidney notices and raises a tentative hand to brush the offending item away. Before he can move Alison silently takes his wrist in a vice-like grip.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Alison is haranguing Sidney. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you insane? That was Lawrence's wife, Elizabeth! Her father owns Sharps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was her? The Mussolini baby? He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could go back and tell her I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Listen to me - you do NOT approach Elizabeth Maddox, you do NOT talk to her! Don't even make eye-contact with her? Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I supposed to be afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know the meaning of the word fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure there are many words you don't know the meaning of! She walks on, shaking her head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I think of all the people who would kill to be where you are. And you lumber in here, spitting food, haven't got the brains God gave a mollusc...why  did Clayton hire you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snipe Magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Clayton left college he started this little magazine called Snipe. Fantastic. Took aim at every self-important celebrity in town. Completely fearless. It was like my magazine but twenty years earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why he's hired me. I am the young Clayton Harding. He looks at me and sees his glory days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His glory days? Sharps has won fourteen National Magazine awards and increased its advertising pages by more than 60 percent since he took over. He's paid millions of dollars a year. He  lives in a Bank Street townhouse, and weekends in the Hamptons. Clayton Harding is one of the lynchpins of the media-industrial complex. Sidney stops to examine his reflection in a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but don't worry. I think I might still be in time to save him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone is ringing. Sidney walks in from the bedroom, changing into his old brown suit. The answer machine kick in.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (over answer machine) You've reached Sidney Young. I'm sorry but my answering machine is out of order, so the voice you are hearing is actually me. The machine BEEPS. Sidney smirks at his joke and is reaching for the phone when we hear the caller - an older man, an upper-class English accent.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (over answer machine) Sidney? Are you there? Sidney stops in his tracks, something complicated and fearful crossing his face.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN'S VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sidney? Are you there? Sidney tiptoes back out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN'S VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you're there Sidney, answer the phone. We hear the opening of Fly Me To The Moon by Julie London 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney sits in the car beside Alison and Maddox, staring out the window, entranced by the bright lights as they pa by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rooftop swimming pool of a hotel. Flowers everywhere, including in the pool. Guests mill around drinking. We fi Sidney working his way through the throng to where Alison stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a couple of hundred grands worth of food here and I swear I'm the only person eating it. You want some? Alison recoils. Sidney does a little nerdy dance to the music as he eats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is amazing. It's wall to wall totty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wall to wall what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totty. Babes. Sexually attractive women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Maddox joins them. A man passes, nods respectfully at Maddox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that. All night people have been treating us like we're royalty. In London, the journalist's motto is "Everybody hates us and we don't care."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now you're one of the High Priests of what's Hot and what's Not. So what were you two talking about? 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney was just marvelling at the abundance of "Totty" here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. I don't think Miss Olsen approves of you, Sidney. Sidney watches some beautiful women pass, dripping diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't be here. I get thrown out of places like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This? This is a McDonald's. I hate disease parties. (Off Sidney's puzzled look) Fund- raisers. Someone's CELL PHONE RINGS. All of the guests automatical check their cells. An OLDER ATTRACTIVE WOMAN walks over - she's a little drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence Maddox? Oh my goodness... Long time. Maddox examines her coolly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel! Lawrence barely bothers to conceal the fact he doesn't remember her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm just wonderful. Wonderful. How are you? Lawrence smiles and looks around him without answering. Rachel tries again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny I should run into you. I've just done this great little film called Five Boroughs and it's you know, low-budget, first-time director but very, uh, moving and... Hey, maybe you could do a little...? 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A handsome YOUNG MAN passes by. Maddox instantly turns aw from Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angelo, good to see you. Rachel hovers for a moment, embarrassed by her abrupt dismissal then slips away. Sidney watches her go, feeling for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that was Rachel Petkoff?  She's a fantastic actress. Hasn't done anything for years, but, in her day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, I've heard about that film. I think she's going to make a come back. We should get there first, do a profile or something before everyone else... Maddox isn't listening. Instead he greets a fat, angry- looking VERY YOUNG MAN. This is VINCENT LEPAK, wearing hi customary SHADES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent! Great to see you. Children, I'd like to introduce you to Vincent Lepak, enfant  terrible and in, my opinion, the  most exciting new director in  American cinema.  Vincent nods, frowning, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is the worst fundraiser I've been to in my whole life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rat fuck, isn't it? Sidney walks away.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL 47
dialogues.text: ...standing at the parapet, smoking, staring out over the city with red eyes. Sidney appears beside her. 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? Aren't you Rachel  Petkoff?  Rachel turns to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is sort of embarrassing but... He holds out a napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I have your autograph? Rachel, suspecting she is the target of ridicule, looks around to see if there's an audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a big fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. I must have seen everything you've been in. Those episodes of The Love Boat and the Bionic Woman? The Song Birds, In The Night...I've even seen your first ever TV appearance. The Twilight Zone - House of Mirrors. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My all time favorite? A Day Too Long. (He means it) You were really great in that. Rachel stares at him. She hides her emotion with a bright smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney Young. She takes the napkin and pen, her face glowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney Young. I'll remember that. 37.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENT 48
dialogues.text: ...holding court to Maddox, Alison and some of the Glitterati. Sidney joins them, eating more food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look around and it's all shit. No-one is making movies that are fucking worthwhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have to disagree with you, Vincent. Vincent looks at him, displeased.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE MADDOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're making movies that are worthwhile. Vincent accepts this with a curt nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what I'm saying. You have to inspire yourself. I am my role- model. I want to be me... He stares angrily around, handing his empty glass to his waiting assistant who immediately replaces it with a full one from a passing tray. Sidney watches him with dislike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greatest film ever made?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the greatest film ever made? (To Alison) Go on. Have a guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's...I don't think there is one single film that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, have a guess - what is the greatest film ever made? 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't, uh...well personally I love La Dolce Vita but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incorrect. Con Air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhuh, Con Air. It's got everything. Malkovich for your acting chops, Nicky Cage for action, Buscemi for comedy, John Cusack for the Gays. It's a smorgasbord. The group study him, trying to work out if this is irony idiocy. Maddox is staring daggers at him. An extremely thin, fashionably dressed woman smiles at Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we've been introduced?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Young, this is Eleanor Johnson, Queen of New York. Eleanor this is Sidney Young. He's from England and he's our very own Idiot Savant. Without the Savant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's always nice to have fresh blood at these things. (To Maddox) Which reminds me, I'm here with Sophie Maes, I want you to meet her. New film, The Suffragette coming out, the buzz is A-mazing. The release is tied in with the roll-out of the Reebok campaign, and now Louis Vuitton's on the line. This train is leaving the station Lawrence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're a publicist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really like that word, Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should I call you? 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can call me Eleanor. She stares past him, across the pool.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR JOHNSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There she is. They turn to see a young woman standing across the pool from them. This is SOPHIE MAES - a natural beauty, statuesque, no make-up, hair simply pulled back. Sophie tries to walk around the pool to join them but fin she can't work her way through the crowd. She turns to he right but finds her way similarly blocked. She hesitates for a moment and then with a shrug climbs down into the pool, the water up to her chest, and begins to walk through the floating flowers towards them. Sidney stares at her, TRANSFIXED. Alison notices this wit some contempt. Gradually everyone notices Sophie and stops to look. Having reached the other side, Sophie ascends the pool steps, laughing, her dress clinging to her: Venus rising from the waves. The Photographers appear, snapping merril away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this one will go far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie, still in her wet dress, Eleanor and Sophie's ENTOURAGE are striding through the hotel's corridors, on their way out. Maddox, Sidney and Alison are with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on cell phone) Where's the car? What's it doing at the back? Forget what I said. I want the car at the front. Now. Sidney finds himself walking alongside Sophie and Maddox, trying not to stare at Sophie's breasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I just think it's terrible the way we're still exploiting animals. That's why, you know, I won't wear fur or leather, I won't wear make-up, I'm vegetarian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with you... 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie turns to him with a vague smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't eat anything with, you know, eyebrows. He snickers nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or if it can chuckle. I won't eat animals that can chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I can't understand your accent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, just, uh...So you're an actress? Have I seen you in anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (Trying again) So you haven't won any Oscars yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I would certainly vote for you for best supporting dress! Huh, huh, huh....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been nominated for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm just...I'm saying you look... They have reached the front entrance of the hotel. Eleano steps between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready dear? The front doors glide open to reveal a LEGION OF PAPARAZZ waiting outside. As Sophie steps outside there is a sudde roar of photographers shouting and the night sky blazes white as HUNDREDS OF CAMERAS FLASH SIMULTANEOUSLY. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVERSE - the group framed in the entrance-way - blinded by the glare, squinting. Only Sophie has her eyes open, smiling, looking like a star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Paparazzi are still crowding around the group as they make their way to the waiting car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going on to the Circle Club. I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Good night. Maddox slips his jacket around Sophie's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you cold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from Canada, land of ice and snow. They get into the car. Sidney tries to follow them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budge up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming to the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, you're not on the list. A small CHIHUAHUA - CUBA - on Sophie's lap snarls at Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE MADDOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See? Even Cuba says so. Maddox closes the door and the car glides away, Sophie kissing the dog on the nose. The Paparazzi hurry back to the entrance as another celebrity emerges, leaving Alison and Sidney staring after the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's... that turns my stomach. Pawing her like that. He's old enough to be her father. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No he isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes he is. I started producing sperm when I was thirteen, so you know, technically...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your information he wasn't pawing her! He was just doing his job! In case you haven't noticed Sharps has to have a star on the cover every month. And most of those stars are clients of Eleanor's. So do not piss her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a flak. Hacks don't take orders from flaks. And I don't think you can call that "doing his job." The man had no blood left in his upper body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you...? Oh, and next time you want to do the hilariously ironic I love Con Air skit would you mind...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't being ironic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...would you mind not involving me, especially in the presence of Vincent Lepak who happens to be very important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I could tell by the way he was allowed to stay up past his bed time. The car disappears into the distance. They watch it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think she'd go out with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie Maes. You think she'll go out with me? 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Girls like Sophie don't date journalists. As far as she's concerned, you're the help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know? A lot of these starlets are lonely. They spend their time looking for a man. Alison starts to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is New York, Sidney. Women only date men who are successful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to be successful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she goes) ...and tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney sits in front of his computer reading the on-line New York Post Page Six. A story on the previous night is accompanied by a large picture of Sophie in her clinging dress. Above the picture is the title Venus Envy. Sidney stares at the picture, entranced. Alison sits at her desk, watching him with contempt. Madd appears beside them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen this? She's everywhere. An ASSISTANT walks over with a MUFFIN BASKET for Maddox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Sophie Maes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the card) "Thanks for a great night." What a sweet kid. Oh, Sidney, about last night - word of advice. Don't talk to the celebrities, okay? Sophie said you made her feel uncomfortable. He walks off with a slight smirk. Sidney glowers after hi 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney walks down the corridor. He slows, his expression changing suddenly. SIDNEY'S P.O.V - Elizabeth Maddox is walking down the corridor towards us, face set. Sidney keeps on walking, staring to one side of Elizabeth As they draw level, the heel of one of Elizabeth's shoes snaps off and she lurches sideways, colliding with the wa before sprawling onto the floor in front of Sidney. Sidney hesitates. He notices Alison watching with baited breath from the other end of the corridor. For a moment nobody moves then Sidney steps over Elizabeth's prone for without a word and keeps on walking. Alison gives a sigh of relief, nods in approval and walks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clayton heads a monthly staff meeting. A rather smug Madd is just finishing a pitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so Brad's people finally got back to me and they've agreed. We've got the whole afternoon, before the shoot. People clap. Harding nods approvingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work Lawrence. Okay, well, if that's it for... He starts to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I was thinking, Clay... Clayton, pauses, frowning. Sidney turns to the room, cocksure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris Hilton. I do a profile on her as if she's this complete recluse, this hermit...(laughing) I try and track her down and, you know, "Who is the elusive Paris Hilton and why is she so publicity shy?" He laughs for a moment. No one joins in. 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's first room stuff, Sidney. And call me Clay one more time and see what happens. Harding stalks out of the room. Blushing, Sidney stares after him, nodding vaguely. As he gathers his notebook he becomes aware of the smirks on the faces of Maddox and th others as they leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison sits with her notebook and pen. Behind her some of the magazine's glamorous Fashionistas - VICKY, INGRID and ANNA - are examining some clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'd love these but I'm so fat I couldn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look totally rexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice? Alison hides her irritation with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Vicky she looks rexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rexy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anorexic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...you do look like you could do with a few more pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, that's so sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, post-shoot clear out. Got some Gucci pants here that are way too big for us. You wanna try? 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (another tight smile) No, thanks. She looks up as Sidney sits heavily beside her, stares at her with puppy-dog eyes. Alison tries to ignore him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to be rude Sidney but...what the fuck do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you know how things work around here. How am I going to get something in the magazine? Alison stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought all this "fluff" was beneath you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is but...things have changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's changed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know people think I'm a bit of an idiot and maybe I haven't started off too well here, but I want...I want... He seems so awkward that Alison begins to soften a little

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I want to have sex with Sophie Maes. (Beat) Before Maddox does. Alison's expression turns to disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're loathsome, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he's got a head start on me but I'm going to win her back. Once I get my hooks into a girl, they never get free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like ring-worm. She gets up and stalks out. Sidney glances through the glass partition and sees MADDOX walking past. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gloves are coming off. We hear the opening of Brigitte Bardot's Moi Je Joue as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is pitching to Clayton in the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Celebrity Trash Cans. The contents of celebrity trash cans are revealed and readers have gotta guess who the trash belongs to... Five bottles of Jack Daniels, a court order, and a copy of Mein Kampf? Mel Gibson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting out the lift) First Room, Sidney. First room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small group of GLITTERATI pass the immense line of hopefuls waiting outside the club and are ushered inside the DOORMAN at the entrance. Sidney walks confidently up, pretending to talk into his cell. The Doorman stands in h way, impassive. Still talking Sidney turns and walks away as if nothing has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney standing with a MODEL-TYPE in the elevator. He tak a LAMINATED PHOTOGRAPH from his wallet and shows it to he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at the snap) Guess who that is with Clint Eastwood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan Freeman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not...why's everyone say...? There! In the head-lock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney pitches to a closed door in the office. He is holding a LARGE PIECE OF CARD on which is drawn a TREE decorated with the heads of various CELEBRITIES. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Shag Tree. It illustrates all of the sexual pairings of Hollywood's top stars and how they interconnect... From under the door slides a piece of paper on which is written First Room. We hear a TOILET FLUSH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney approaches the Doorman , takes a ten dollar bill from his pocket and hands it to the Doorman. The Doorman crumples the bill up and throws it away. Without a word Sidney begins to walk away. He comes back and picks up th crumpled note and then heads off again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harding is eating lunch at his desk. He looks up and find Sidney staring down at him with puppy-dog eyes. Beat. Harding sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I give you an interview will ya leave me the fuck alone? Sidney smiles. The song ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan Lane shakes hands with Sidney as he sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan Lane. Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great to meet you Nathan. I'm a big fan. I love that rat thing you played in The Lion King.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually he's a meer cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (absently, checking his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhuh... Now, I've been doing some research and I think you're probably quite a private man. Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is fine, but today, I think it would be great to get behind the mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I don't think there really is a mask as such, and I don't wanna be a pain, but what I really wanna talk about is the new play, keep it about the work, you know? Is that okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Of course. So, first question - are you Jewish? Nathan stares at Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see what the relevance of that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Next question. The rat thing - that's gotta be Disney's first gay animal, right? So, I was wondering - are you a homosexual? Beat. Nathan looks like he might hit Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clayton glares at Sidney from behind his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't upset anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't upset anyone. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just trying to...probe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna probe become a proctologist, okay? You can't ask musical comedy stars whether they're Jewish or gay. From now on just assume they're all Jewish and all gay, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is on the phone. He has been idly applying magic tape to his face, contorting it into a grotesque grimace. The headline of a magazine open in front of him reads: "Everyone Loves A Lord: Why British Titles Drive New York Women Crazy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to apply for an American Express card please? (Beat) Hon. Sidney Young. (Beat) As in Honourable. H-O-N. (Beat)It's a British title. Across the desk Alison watches him with contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Queen? Yeah, I know the Queen. Just fill in the form will you? Sidney suddenly notices Sophie Maes and Eleanor Johnson walking towards them. Sophie looks more STYLED than befor She is holding her Chihuahua, Cuba, which is dressed in a tiny coat. Sidney DISAPPEARS UNDER THE DESK. We hear a RI as he yanks the tape off his face.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (in pain, under desk) Oh, fuck...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Cuba! He pets the dog, who greets him enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm one of the Friends Of Cuba. 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs, Sophie smiles, not getting it. Alison seems immersed in some paper-work.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE MADDOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So how's it feel to be a star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't! It's so embarrassing! That picture's everywhere now. And I had no idea the dress was so see-through! And people are talking like it was some kind of stunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a cynical age. Hello Sidney. Embarrassed, Sidney gets up from under his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello! Didn't, didn't know you were coming in...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence is taking us to lunch at Cipriani.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great. That's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence? Could I leave Cuba here? He doesn't like Italian food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you can. He can stay in my office. Sidney? Fetch Cuba a bowl of water, will you? Sidney stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcing a smile) Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor is getting a cup of water from the cooler. Sidney joins her, waiting to fill the dog's bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is a lovely ring. Where is that from? 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney looks at the wedding ring he wears on his little finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my mother's. She gave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you Sweetie. That is very, very...(dismissing the topic) So, listen...You've met Vincent Lepak haven't you, Sidney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhuh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a new movie coming out soon and Lawrence is over- stretched as it is. How would you like to write a story on him? Alison, at the photocopier nearby, listens. Sidney smiles, filled with hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A story? Absolutely. That would...I'd love to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, great. Maybe we could get together and discuss the angle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (Beat) What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'd need to know how we're going to present Vincent, check the story, so on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want copy approval?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any stories written about my clients need to be in their best interest, that's all. If things work out with Vincent we could maybe talk about a follow up story on Sophie? What do you think? Alison listens, her face registering her distaste. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney looks over at Sophie, struggling with himself. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Eleanor, I don't...I don't work that way. Alison stares with surprise at Sidney. He just went up in her estimation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney dear, think of it like this: you write about one of my clients, you are borrowing some of their "star-light" to help sell your magazine. All I'm saying is quid pro quo. Sidney is unable to hold back a snicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their star-light? Eleanor's face hardens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney watches Sophie, Maddox and Eleanor as they walk towards reception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney cracks open the door and peers inside. Cuba sits i the middle of the floor, staring at him. He emits a low growl. Sidney slides into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Cuba. I'm Uncle Sidney, come to see how you are. You wanna play? You wanna little play? He takes a RUBBER BALL out of his pocket and holds it up for the dog to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fetch! He tosses the ball in the air. Cuba runs after it and trots back, stumpy tail wagging, the ball in its teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! That's it! 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strokes the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna be best pals aren't we? You're going to like me more than that prick Maddox, aren't you? Fetch! He tosses the ball again which promptly bounces off the wall straight out of the half open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Cuba is already running towards the window... Sidney's yell slows and distorts as we move to SLOW MOTION... Sidney springs forward, leaping onto the desk and then in one bound onto a FILING CABINET by the window, sending it rocking slightly forward. Cuba, bounding forward, jumps into the air... Sidney just manages to slam the window SHUT as... BACK IN NORMAL TIME... Cuba bounces off the glass with a yelp and drops to the floor. Sidney heaves a sigh of relief. Then a METAL SCULPTURE on the tilted filing cabinet slide forward and drops with a TERMINAL THUD ON THE DOG BELOW. Silence. Sidney stares down to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuba?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney stands at the lift holding a bulging bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waiting for the lift) C'mon...C'mon... Alison walks past, sees him and does a double-take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing her coming) Shit, shit, shit... 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just...just borrowing it. I'll bring it straight back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Give it back. She reaches out to take the bag. Sidney holds on desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
