dialogues.text: Stop it! Give me the... She tugs violently, pulling the bag open. A small PAW lol out. Alison freezes staring at it. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just trying to make friends. Please don't tell her. Please don't tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuba? Cuba? Startled, Sidney darts into Maddox's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As footsteps and voices approach Sidney tugs wildly at  Maddox's window, trying to open it. Alison follows him in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? You can't...!  He jerks the window open and empties Cuba out of it,  slamming it shut just as Sophie, Eleanor and Lawrence wal in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison, have you seen Cuba? 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W-What? She darts a glance over to where Sidney stands with his back to the window, gazing at her pleadingly. From behind him comes a faint creaking sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie's dog! Have you seen him? Sidney hangs his head, awaiting the coup de grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...no. No idea. Sidney stares at her in amazement. Behind him Cuba's body appears at the window, rising into view on a WINDOW WASHING PLATFORM. A Window Washer, stand at the other end of the cradle, bobbing his head to the music in his headphones. Alison stares at the dog in horror while the others talk, oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, he couldn't have got  very far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuba? Cuba! Cuba trundles on up to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clayton stands at the window. He is DRUNK. There is a kno at the door and Sidney walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clayton? Have you got a minute? Clayton lights a cigarette, stares out of the window. Sidney comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they find that rat yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...Not yet. I think maybe he got out the building? Sidney hovers. 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations on the Man of the Year thing. How was the lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Thousand dollars a plate, all I could taste was ass. I'm kissing their ass, they're kissing my ass. (Beat) I get this dream sometimes. Someone's set fire to the building - Heywoods - Sharps magazine - the whole thing, it's going up in flames. My analyst thinks it's an anxiety dream. I never tell him how happy I am watching the fucker burn. Sidney isn't sure what to say. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: CLAYTON HARDING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you want? Sidney takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to do a story on Vincent Lepak. Not a puff-piece. Something funny, but with teeth. The kind of thing Snipe would have done. Everyone's treating him like he's a genius and he's an idiot. Clayton notices the CLOSET-DOOR beside him and opens it. stares at the rows of blue shirts hanging in there. He takes an armful out and examines them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at these things. How'd I get a closet full of blue fucking shirts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know either. This is an office for Christ's sake! Why've I even got a fucking closet? He drops the shirts.

dialogues.speaker: CLAYTON HARDING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he can't believe it) Do it? 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it. Yeah. Do it. He's an annoying little prick. Go take him down. This is your shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Clayton!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my little Hit Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your little Hit Man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! He scuttles out. He ducks back around the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could call me The Jackal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! He ducks back out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is waiting in the lobby. A slightly spaced YOUNG WOMAN approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Young?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sophie Maes' assistant. I'm afraid Sophie isn't here right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking past her) Look I know she's in. I'm not a stalker. I just know she's upset about losing her dog and... 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She isn't here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, can I at least check that she got my present?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Did you send the flowers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flowers? Yeah,'cos she doesn't get enough flowers, does she? No, I sent her the fish. The Young Woman looks suddenly nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gold-fish. In a bowl. Did she get them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but...they were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was kinda shocking. Were they dead when you sent them? Sidney stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No, they were... Who sends people dead fish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mafia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison sits at the bar, staring at her notebook, a pen he in her hand. A WHITE RUSSIAN sits on the bar beside her. Sidney slides onto the stool beside her. She looks up and sees he is holding a glass bowl of water with three dead fish in it. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, you're like a serial killer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wasn't me. (Beat) I...I laid him to rest. Cuba I mean. I took him over to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to know. Alison checks the door, looking for someone, a little uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (Beat) Well, I just...I just wanted to say...about not telling them...I really appreciated it. It was good of you and, and...you know...not many people would, uh... He stops, tongue-tied. Alison takes pity on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you? Alison sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need my help to screw up here, Sidney. I mean, the only things you make are mistakes and stains. The BARMAN arrives, stares at the bowl of fish disapprovingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (following his gaze) Just a couple of straws please. Stony-faced, the Barman walks off. Despite herself, Aliso smiles. Sidney smiles back. He notices Alison's NOTEBOOK the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something? How come you've always got the notebook? Is it a diary or something? Am I in it? 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...it's a novel I'm working on, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. I know. I'm a walking clichГ©.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No - a novel, that's...that's pretty impressive. You're writing it by hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it...I don't know. It keeps it separate from the magazine work. Makes it seem special. He stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're full of surprises, Sister. Suddenly he notices the White Russian beside them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...you waiting for your boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he do, the mystery guy? Is he a hack too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually he's a poet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? What's he look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just most poets you see aren't really good-looking, are they? Spend their time stuck in a room, end up looking like Golem. Is he...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's very handsome, thank you. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I don't understand? You're desperate to get a story in the magazine - so why wouldn't you play ball with Eleanor, write the puff-piece?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I resent being bribed to gush sycophantically about a star, okay? I choose to gush sycophantically. Alison stares at Sidney trying to figure him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay anyway. Clayton's given me a story. I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's good. Sidney smiles back at her. They look at each other...it's almost the start of a MOMENT... Then suddenly on the TV above the bar, a MOVIE TRAILER begins. Distracted Sidney turns to watch - it's Sophie Maes' new film - The Suffragette - Sophie, a glamorous Emily Pankhurst... Sidney looks back to Alison but she has turned away, suddenly awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well...better get going.(Leaving) You take my advice, you'll get yourself a boyfriend who's going to show up once in a while. He leaves. Beat. Alison stares at the empty stool beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clayton is rounding up another staff meeting. Sidney sits trying to contain his excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which makes it...a half page left. Lawrence? Any ideas? 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Rachel Petkoff, fabulous  sixties actress, one of my all time favourites. Just made a wonderful movie called Five Boroughs. I think she's poised for a come-back and I think we should get there first, do a profile. Sidney stares at him in disbelief. He looks over to Aliso who avoids his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good. Let's do it. Okay that's it people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...Clayton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you read my story on Vincent Lepak? Clayton frowns down at some papers, feigning distraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Oh, yeah. That's...that's not going to work. Sidney can't believe it. Clayton gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: CLAYTON HARDING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, and for those who haven't heard, Alison is going to be running the I Spy section from now on as Lawrence here has just gone up in the world. He is replacing Greg Roberts as Deputy Editor. Lawrence smiles modestly as the room applauds. Sidney loo like he is going to implode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maddox passes Sidney in the corridor. Sidney glares after him. Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel Petkoff? One of your  favourite actresses? You'd never fucking heard of her! That was my idea! Lawrence stops and turns back. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it was. You have any more good ideas don't forget to bring them to my new office. He is about to walk on but remembers something.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE MADDOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By the way, there've been complaints about you skulking around the water-cooler, trying to talk to women. It's inappropriate behaviour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You spend half your life chatting up the staff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I do it it's called flirting. When you do it it's called sexual harassment. Consider this an official warning. I won't tolerate sexist behaviour. He walks off. Sidney glowers after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence is holding a meeting in his new office - half a dozen heads of departments sit around drinking coffee. Lawrence sits behind his desk, enjoying his new authority

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that wasn't Greg's way of  working but Greg isn't deputy  editor any more. I am, and I'm making changes. There is a knock at the door and Sidney walks in with an attractive BLONDE WOMAN in a long coat and dark glasses.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE MADDOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Lawrence? This lady's been looking for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the woman) Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Lawrence Maddox? The new deputy editor? 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've just come to say congratulations on your promotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I'm sorry, you are...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your present. The Woman produces a Beat-Box from behind her back and switches it on. She drops her coat to reveal underwear an stockings underneath. Maddox stares in frozen horror as the STRIPPER dances ove to him, removing her bra.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: A Very Well-Dressed Middle-Aged Woman knocks on the door and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mrs Harding. Two Impeccably-Dressed Little Girls follow Mrs Harding in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! So adorable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Little Girls) And this is the Fashion Department. [To Ingrid] Where's Mr Maddox now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh he's down the hall. Room 217.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The staff are staring transfixed as the stripper gyrates her breasts, whirling NIPPLE TASSELS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with mock horror) Uh, Lawrence? This is...this is sort of inappropriate isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please... 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His words are muffled by the bra the stripper drapes over his face. Gleefully, Sidney dances in the background. He produces a camera and starts to snap away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, this is...this is awful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stripper, who we suddenly realise is BOB THE TRANSEXU in a blonde wig, whips off his/her panties. There is a collective gasp from the room. Sidney can't stop laughing Suddenly he notices everyone in the room is now staring a the door. He turns to see Mrs Harding and her girls standing, shell-shocked, in the doorway. Alarmed, Sidney side-steps in towards Bob.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Bob, impressive breasts bared, stands staring back at us. Sidney, in the absence of anything else to shield him wit is HOLDING BOB'S PENIS. The rest of the staff stare at us, rabbits caught in headlights. After a beat Lawrence peers around Sidney, a rictus smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mrs Harding. Girls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney sits waiting, obsessively cleaning his hand with a wet-wipe. Through the glass partition we can see Clayton and Eleanor Johnson in the office. They are apparently discussing a mock-up of a new cover for Sharps. After a moment Eleanor comes out of the office and sweeps past Sidney without a glance. Clayton appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney sits in front of Clayton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know it was Take Our Daughters To Work Day. I didn't even know there was a Take Our daughters To Work Day. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. (Beat) You know, when I told my wife I'd hired another Brit, she was excited. She still thinks you're all like something from Pride and Prejudice. But you Sidney ...you're like a British person born in New Jersey. (Shaking his head) Why did I hire you? Sidney stares at his feet. Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know - why did you hire me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had an attack of nostalgia. It's passed. Like gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was wrong with my story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you kill my Vincent Lepak story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't good enough. Plain and simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't good enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't do hatchet jobs here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't a hatchet job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This opening quotation - "It's only too easy to catch people's attention by doing something worse than anyone else has dared do it before..." Who are you thinking of here? Vincent or yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a talentless, pretentious little twat who thinks cinema began with Tarantino and someone needs to say it. And you told me to do something with teeth! You said... 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to run a fucking magazine here! Sidney stares at him, angry and disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "A free press is the last defence against the Tyranny of Stupidity."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save me your tin-pot philosophy, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't mine. It's yours. First issue of Snipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, grow the fuck up, will ya! You're not Robin Hood and you never were. You bitch about famous people for the same reason I bitched about them. Because they got invited to the Party and you didn't. Well you're at the Party now so quit bitching and do your job! You're on your last life here, you understand? One more fuck up like today and you're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't you have to run a decision like that past Eleanor first? For a second Clayton looks like he might throw his ashtra at Sidney. Then he controls himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out. Sidney crosses to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he can't help himself) Looks like I was too late to save you after all. He walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney walks back through the magazine's open plan area. WORKERS stop whatever they're doing and watch him pass in silence. Then, slowly, one of them begins to CLAP. 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone else joins in. Then someone else. Soon they're al clapping. Someone gets up on their desk, then another... Sidney smiles faintly then... BLINKS out of HIS DAY-DREAM. Everyone around him is working as always, paying him no attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are TRACKING through Magazine Staff, celebrities, politicians and children as they mill about the lawns of the sprawling mansion, enjoying the Fourth Of July celebrations which are in progress. Clayton greets guests the perfect host. We find Sidney, wearing unfashionable shorts, socks and shoes. He is talking to Alison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hired a stripper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't "hire" him. Bob did it for a favour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you wanted to be a success here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do! It's just...(ruefully) It wasn't me. It was Clark. Alison laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The famous alter-ego? How long's he been hanging around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I was a kid. Anytime something got broken, or the bathroom got accidentally set on fire - it wasn't me. It was Clark. (Beat.) The weird thing is, he kind of took over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, twenty, twenty one... Alison laughs. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let me tell you, if only you could get rid of that Clark, you could be a real winner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clayton's not going to print anything I write. I've been on salary for six-months and I've written precisely one hundred and seventy five words. On a dollar- per-word basis, I'm the highest paid writer in the history of this magazine.(Beat) He's not going to renew my contract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you expect, Sidney? Vincent's one of Eleanor's clients. I told you. They're Untouchables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought Clayton was different. I really did. (Beat) The only thing I'm good at is pissing people off, and he won't let me do it. (Beat) "My glory walks hand in hand with my doom." (Off her look) Troy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy, the movie. He stares around him at the other guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody hates me here. You're the only one who'll talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cornered me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little embarrassed) No, I mean it. You're the person who's been most, you know... uh...abusive to me. Alison laughs again. They smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want another drink? 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, smiling) Alright. I'll have a beer. Sidney walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is getting a drink at the bar that has been set up in the grounds. Suddenly he stiffens, watching as Sophie Maes, looking spectacular, walks over to where Maddox and his circle are talking nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie, my darling. Looking ravishing as always. Whilst the two are engaged in kissing cheeks, Sidney take a credit card from his wallet and drops it surreptitiousl by Sophie's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I read the other day? Your collection of poems - The Hollow Heart? Man, they're great. Sidney reacts to this, feeling troubled for some reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You write poems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In another life. The BARMAN is handing out drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a White Russian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here. Sidney stares at the drink, feeling like he's just been punched in the stomach. Maddox notices him.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE MADDOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, well, if it isn't Sidalee. Maddox notices the card at Sophie's feet.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE MADDOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (picking it up) What's this? "Hon Young".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's...that's mine. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But your name's not "Hon".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching for it) It's short for "Honourable".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisking it away) As in, "the Honourable Sidney Young"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I please...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding it out of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how come it says "Hon Young"? They made you sound like some Korean medical student. The people gathered around laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They screwed it up. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney baby, you don't wanna go faking a British title to impress Sophie. It's the Fourth of July. (Handing back the card): We're celebrating the fact that we threw a bunch of British aristocrats out. Sidney smiles tightly. Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you shut up, Maddox? Beat. The others look to Maddox to see how he will react. Maddox smiles dangerously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful Sidney. Remember - if it wasn't for us you'd all be speaking German.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Canadian. If it wasn't for us you'd be speaking French. Sophie giggles. Maddox doesn't like this but before he ca answer Sidney walks off. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison is about to walk into the bathroom when she hears the sound of muffled sobbing and stops. She peers through the slightly open door. HER P.O.V - Elizabeth Maddox stands at the mirror, starin at her reflection. For once she is not wearing her dark glasses and we can see her eyes are red raw from crying.

dialogues.speaker: A LITTLE LATER 84
dialogues.text: Elizabeth walks out of the bathroom, dark glasses back in place, her face a mask once more. She walks off. Alison slips out from a nearby room and watches her go, miserable with guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is staring over to where Alison and Maddox are standing by some trees, deep in conversation. Maddox is tossing nuts into the air and catching them in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering to himself) Choke. Choke. He puts his fingers to his temples as if to channel telekinetic powers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choke...choke... Sidney realizes Harding's wife is passing with her two daughters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mrs Harding. Lovely party. With a look of alarm she shepherds the girls away. A tall older man dressed in white with a long white beard appear next to Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you? Sidney nods gloomily.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Has anyone ever told you before that you have an unusually dark aura?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should walk with bare feet as much as possible, ground all that  negative energy. Sidney examines him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...you're a wizard or...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a spiritual healer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can make a living doing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God no. I'm a dentist.  They stare at the party for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want to do some coke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...no, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel Petkoff stands talking to some other guests. Sidne notices her and walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Hello again? Rachel smiles at him distantly, clearly not remembering him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. (Turning back to the others) No, Lawrence is a wonderful writer. I really felt like he got to the heart of me. Sidney snorts. Rachel turns back to him, faintly irritate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, have we...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney. Sidney Young. We met at... Another GUEST walks past Sidney and kisses Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Five Boroughs the other day and wept! 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney hovers for a moment, ignored, and then walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusk. The guests have gathered on the lawns to watch the fireworks. There are oohs and aahs as the rockets light u the sky. Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: In-ger-lernd! Puzzled the guests turn to where a drunk Sidney is standi on the balustrade of the porch of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In-ger-lernd! In-ger-lerrrrrrnd! He spots HUGH GRANT amongst the crowd, watching him, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! Grant! Come on! In-ger- lerrrr... With that he slips from the balustrade and crashes into t shrubbery below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney limps through the trees, dabbing at a scratch on h face. He passes Alison who is sitting on a tree-swing, lo in thought, swigging absently from a bottle of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Yup. Fine. (Beat) You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. (Beat) No, actually. I hate my life so, you know, I'm gonna get drunk. Sidney nods, vaguely. They stand in awkward silence for a moment. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right...See you... He walks off. Beat. He walks back into frame suddenly. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the...You...having an affair with Maddox! I mean...Maddox for Christ's sake! The Man With Hidden Shallows! Jesus! I mean, I used to think you were...I was starting to...I mean, at first I thought you were a pain but then I started to think...but I mean...Maddox? How can you live with yourself? Alison stares at him, pale, blinking back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't. That's why I've broken up with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's no...that's, you know...(Beat) You broke up with him? Alison walks off. Beat. She walks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which leg did you hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one. Alison kicks the leg.

dialogues.speaker: OW
dialogues.text: She walks off again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney lies beside the pool staring darkly into the water and nursing the beginnings of a hangover. We hear faint music and laughter from where the party continues in the house behind. He notices the reflection of the starry sky in the water and reaching out gloomily to hold one of the stars. The reflection dissolves into ripples. When the water settles Sophie Maes reflection stares back at him. 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's drunk and a good deal of the movie star mystique seems to have evaporated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? There's something very damaged about you. Sidney stares at her, not sure what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh... Sophie lies down beside the pool, plays with a strand of her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like an animal that's been hit by a car or something. Like a deer or...like a pig maybe? When they walk funny and the other animals keep away from them. Little limpy pig. I'm drawn to sick animals. That's why I picked Cuba - because he had like psychological problems? (Her eyes well with tears) Poor little Cuba. Where is he now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh... She wipes her eyes, rolls onto her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I'm wasted. Are you wasted? I'm wasted. Sidney watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations on becoming incredibly famous by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's what like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything. She rolls her head to look at him solemnly. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weird. It's happening so fast and...it's like it's got nothing to do with me. It's like I'm not even really here. She laughs softly.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE MAES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Am I here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here. She turns back to look at the stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you...would you like me to get you some food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? There might still be a photographer around. They lie in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what would be nice though? Some coke. She rubs her face, close to falling asleep.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE MAES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Probably just as well I haven't got any. Coke always makes me so horny. Sidney opens his mouth but cannot speak.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY RUNNING DESPERATELY... 90
dialogues.text: ...through the groups of people chatting outside the hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Wizard! Wizard Dentist Man! Need Wizard Dentist Man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney has virtually dragged the Dentist out of his car. is handing Sidney a wrap. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will never, never, never forget this. Thank you! He starts to hurry away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison is weaving unsteadily towards the driveway. Sidney hurries past then slows and stops, staring back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison stands rooting in her purse for a tip to give the VALET MAN who is holding open the door of her car for her the engine running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of your business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't drive. You need to go and sleep this off somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firstly, you are a stupid asshole and I hate you and Secondly... Secondly... She muses on what she was going to say next. Sidney looks over his shoulder, imagining Sophie waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secondly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. Listen, you try driving in this state you're gonna kill yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd care if I did? Beat. Suddenly she bursts into tears. Surprised, Sidney stands, uncertain what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go. Got to go. Sidney holds her to stop her falling. He stares back at t pool and then down at Alison. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is driving. Alison is still drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I had it all figured out. A - get the hell out of Port Huron, come to New York. B - do the serious journalism thing to pay the bills while I, you know, write the novel. C- Win a Pulitzer. E...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D - I don't know what D was. Then I took the internship at Sharps and I met Maddox and he was...he was so...and before I know it I'm writing, you know, Ten Tips for the fucking Metrosexual and pretending this is what I wanted but this ISN'T what I wanted! And that's...that's why I hated you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you hated me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...because you were right about me. I'm a ghoul, writing fluff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a Ghoul. You're a Zombie. Alison leans her head against the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he isn't the person you think he is, okay? Maddox. That's just a front. He thinks he's let himself down by giving up the poetry and he's unhappy. And the marriage is a sham, I mean... I just...I couldn't end it. I just couldn't and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't take anymore) Look, I don't need to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to root through her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a cigarette. Where are my fucking cigarettes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. She looks at her reflection in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I have low self- esteem? Am I afraid of a real relationship? Do I think an affair is all I deserve? I mean, okay, he's handsome and successful and he's great in bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you just be quiet? He realises she has started to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I told him I couldn't see him any more...I don't know if he cared. I love him and, and I don't know if he cares! Sidney watches, moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm...I'm sure he does. He's probably just not very good at expressing his emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so fucking sophisticated! I mean there's not even a little bit of Port Huron left, right? I've got the haircut and the job and I've got the parties and I've even, I've even got the affair because that's what sophisticated fucking people do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Alright. Don't, you know, get snot everywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh G-God... 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Alison lurches down out of sight and is sick on Sidney's shorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is driving through Manhattan, the windows down. Alison is asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison? What's your address? (Beat. Shaking her) Alison? Alison snores loudly. Sidney sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney staggers up the stairs carrying Alison over his shoulder. Alison is moaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up will you? You'll wake the old witch up. He stops suddenly and turns. Mrs Kowalski glowers at him from the doorway. Sidney freezes - a sickly smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did...Did we wake you?

dialogues.speaker: OH GOD
dialogues.text: An ELDERLY MAN appears behind Mrs Kowalski staring at Sidney. Long Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, Mrs Kowalski and Sidney's father - RICHARD YOUNG sit drinking coffee. Richard has an absent-minded air, wears a somewhat shabby jacket. Sidney seems to have almo physically shrunk in the presence of his father. Some music is playing in the next room. Alison dances drunkenly past the doorway, wearing Sidney's jacket. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she goes by) Love this song... The three stare after her. Sidney coughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She, uh, she isn't actually a prostitute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh good. Alison dances back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sooo, Sidney's dad. Good to meet you. I'm Alison. I'm from Port Huron. (To Mrs Kowalski) And you must be Sidney's mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I am not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. My dad married again too, so that's cool. (To Richard) You wanna dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Where are my cigarettes? (feeling in the pocket of the jacket) What is that? She produces the wrap of coke that the elderly man had given Sidney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, is that....? She stops herself. Everyone stares at the wrap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it is probably cocaine. Sidney closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't actually for me. I was going to give it to this young actress... He realises this isn't helping and trails off. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, hey, visiting your boy. That's nice. You must be pretty proud of him, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should lie down Alison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing just great at the magazine. Alison ruffles Sidney's hair clumsily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First we all thought he was kinda creepy because he was always hanging around the water-cooler, hitting on women...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really Alison, I think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I think that was pretty much an act. So, Mister Sidney, whatcha doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, call me Richard. I've written a little book so I'm doing a few talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A book! Hey - I'm writing a book. What's yours about? Don't tell me - it's a thriller, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nothing so interesting I'm afraid. I'm a philosopher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Philosophy? Really? Have you written any... Alison stops dancing, stares at him, something occurring her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...Richard? R.C. Young? You're R.C Young? (To Sidney) You...you didn't say... Sidney avoids her eye. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to hear what you think of the book if you have time to read it. Alison snorts with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would Sidney know about philosophy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he does have a Masters in the subject. Alison stares at Sidney. She breaks into a snorting laugh again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're shitting me! Sidney? He...he likes Con Air! She stops laughing, hit by a sudden wave of nausea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I don't feel very well. Mrs Kowalski stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. It is time you went to bed. (To Sidney) You can sleep on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Better go before I find out something else I don't know about Sidney. Mrs Kowalski turns to Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a pleasure to meet you Lord Young. Alison stares at Sidney who smiles weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Sidney sit alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have said you were coming. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would have required you answering one of my calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been pretty busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which reminds me, I was talking to a publisher friend of mine the other day. He mentioned that they were planning a series of introductory texts on philosophers. I wondered if you would be interested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a job, dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, of course. I picked up a copy of your magazine at the airport. Sidney stiffens a little.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD YOUNG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Most enjoyable. (Beat) I  particularly liked the young  Hollywood actress who said she'd  like to start her theatre career  "somewhere small, like London or  England."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why've you always got to do this? It's...it's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just a joke Sidney...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually it's not. Because you're saying that what I do for a living is worthless and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's worthless. I just think, in your heart, you know you could do more with your life than...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More? Sharps is one of the most respected magazines in the world. There's a million hacks who would kill to be where I am now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who I interviewed recently? Nathan Lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I KNOW you don't know who that is! You don't know who anyone is! You thought Brad Pitt was a cave in Yorkshire! But most people do know who they are, okay? And most people wouldn't think that a journalist who gets to mix with stars like that was a, a disappointment!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you're a disappointment Sidney. I've never thought that. Silence. Richard stands and picks up his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to upset you. Sidney watches his father, struggling with himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things haven't really been that great. I don't know what it is. (Beat) I'm not... getting ahead. Richard stops, turns back to his son. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not happy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm fine. I know I can make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Einstein said "Try not to become a man of success but rather to become a man of value." Sidney doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD YOUNG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The young lady next door... Alison? She wouldn't have anything to do with your desire to stay would she? 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No. We're just friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the way you looked at her. Sidney considers this, knowing it's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't feel that way about me. New York women don't date losers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose not. But Alison is from Port Huron, isn't she? Sidney stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Sidney peers into the room to check Alison is okay. She lies asleep on the bed, moonlight bathing her face. She looks beautiful. Sidney stands staring at her for a moment and then tip-to back out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Sidney is cooking, humming, happy that Alison is here. Alison walks in, feeling dreadful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember very much but I'm so, so sorry. I'll get myself together and get going...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? No, you're all right. It's...it's nice to have the company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...your father. And that woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs Kowalski? Don't worry about it. The last woman she caught me with had a penis, so you know...you're a big step up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices a black and white photograph of a glamorous WOMAN on the shelf. We recognise her as the woman on the at the beginning of the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don't take after her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was she a model?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Movies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some. British, small parts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she died when I was young. Without thinking he fiddles with the ring on his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have been pretty cool having your mom in the movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I suppose. I used to see her on the TV every now and then when I was growing up. Sort of weird. He carries the plates over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go! English fry-up. Perfect hangover cure. Sidney puts a plate of bacon, eggs and sausages in front her. Alison stares at it, going green. Suddenly she darts from the room. 90.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Sidney is tidying. He upsets Alison's bag from the couch and its contents spill onto the floor - the NOTEBOOK is amongst them. Sidney stares at it, hesitates and then, unable to resist opens it up and starts to read. Alison walks into the roo Sidney looks up guiltily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I was just...uh...(He can't think of an excuse) ...rooting through your private possessions... Alison sits on the couch, feeling too ill to be annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. Can I read the rest of it? Believe it or not, I'm a pretty good editor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't even know if I'm going to bother finishing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Keep true to the dreams of thy youth." Alison examines him through narrowed eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that from Troy again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schiller. She puts her things back in her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll jump in the shower and then I really will get out of your hair. Sidney watches, not wanting her to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I forgot...I got you a present. 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands her a bag. Surprised she opens it and takes out RECORD. It's the Nino Rota sound-track to La Dolce Vita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just walking past this music shop on the corner and I saw it. I thought it might cheer you up. Alison is deeply touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's...I don't know what to say. (Beat) I haven't got a turntable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (Beat) Well, you can always come here to listen to it. Sidney takes the record and puts it on the turntable in t corner of the room. He selects the finale music - it's funny and sad, glamorous and romantic... They listen to i for a moment. Sidney starts to dance a little. He cha-cha over to her and holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? I could throw up on you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon... Alison reluctantly gets up. They dance ironically. Alison laughs a little. Gradually they get more into it, enjoying the music - a m in shorts and a woman in pyjamas, cha-cha-chaing, a summe breeze wafting in the through the open windows behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some weeks later. Alison sits at her desk, trying to work She looks up and catches Maddox watching her with soulful eyes from across the room. She looks quickly away, unsettled. Sidney sits at his desk surreptitiously watching her, SMITTEN. 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Autumn. Rain lashes against the window. Alison drinks coffee. Ingrid and Anna are examining a rack of clothes behind her. Ingrid is holding up a dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Alice? Versace. You like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, everyone needs to change their look every now and then. Especially if they have a new man in their life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR OUTSIDE ROOM 104
dialogues.text: Sidney is just about to enter the room.

dialogues.speaker: INGRID, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, that English guy is always hanging around you these days, right? Sidney freezes, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison blushes fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me it isn't so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God. Can you imagine? He's such a creep.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR OUTSIDE ROOM 106
dialogues.text: Sidney listens sadly to the women laughing inside. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison stares at the Fashionistas, annoyed by this. Oblivious, Anna holds up some trousers against herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are gorgeous, but I'm just too fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh don't be crazy! Alice? Is Anna fat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all. Why, she's so thin I could just take her little spindly body and snap it over my knee like a dry fucking twig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and for your information Sidney Young has got more going for him than most of the men in this town. She gets up to leave, the others gawping after her.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR OUTSIDE ROOM 108
dialogues.text: Sidney gives a slow smile of wonder - she likes him! Suddenly he realises Alison is about to walk out the door and catch him listening. Panicking he opens the nearest door and runs in, falling straight down a short flight of stairs and out of sight. Alison walks out of the room and away, oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: E.C.U - On Sidney, staring at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Alison, I was wondering if you wanted to...(Beat. Starting again) Hello there. Listen I was wondering if you wanted to see a movie or...a meal...or...(Beat, starting again.) Alison. You wanna go on a date? We see he is staring at his reflection in a mirror. He slips in a pair of PLASTIC FANGS and smiles toothily. 94.

dialogues.speaker: CLUB
dialogues.text: The SHARPS HALLOWEEN BALL is in full swing - guests danci in fancy dress. Sidney, dressed as Dracula, threads throu the crowd. He spots Alison on the other side of the room, dressed as CAT WOMAN. He starts to make his way towards her, a little nervous. He passes ELEANOR JOHNSON and VINCENT LEPAK. Vincent wear all black and his shades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your costume Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not wearing a costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. They walk on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanker. Sidney continues through the crowd to Alison. He puts his Dracula TEETH in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't we met somewhere before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I don't go there any more. They smile, but Alison seems a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been looking for you actually. There's, uh, there's something I need to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mumbling through his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me first. Listen I was wondering if you want to go to the movies or maybe for a, uh....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I can't understand what you're saying. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney pulls the plastic fangs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I was just saying... Maddox appears and gives Alison a glass of champagne. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in a minute. He walks off again. Sidney stares dumbly after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to tell you. Lawrence has left his wife. We're going to be together. Officially. She watches for Sidney's reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...that's...that's brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so...maybe he does care after all, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. They stand in an awkward silence, watching the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dejected Sidney stands washing his hands. Maddox walks behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Sidney. Someone said you'd come as a Count but I thought I'd misheard. Sidney doesn't answer, turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE MADDOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So Alison told you we were getting together right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Should have done it long ago but, you know me - just not very good at expressing my emotions. Right? 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches Sidney's reaction, smirking.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE MADDOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You must be happy for her, what with you being friends... Sidney blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Sidalee...I thought as much. Did you really think you and Alison...? Things really haven't worked out too well for you here, have they? Ah, well. You gave it your best shot. He walks out. Sidney stares after him, burning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain pours down. Eleanor and Vincent climb into a limousi and close the door. Sidney runs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Eleanor wait! The window glides down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me do the profile on Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. The window begins to slide up. Sidney hangs onto it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get full copy approval. It'll be like you've written it! The window stops. Eleanor stares at him, considering. Sidney looks past her to Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent - think about it, think how humiliating it will be for me. I'm begging you. Vincent leans over, stares over his shades at Sidney. 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat, enjoying this) You don't look like you're begging. Beat. Sidney kneels down on the side-walk beside the limousine. The rain pours down on him. The limousine driv away. Sidney stares dumbly up at something across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the building across the street is an ENORMOUS ANIMATED BILLBOARD L'OREAL ADVERTISEMENT - SOPHIE MAES, in a gold ball-gown and make-up, hair coiffured in classic forties Hollywood style. As we watch she BLOWS US A KISS. Underneath is the slogan - I'm Here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney sits in front of Clayton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence Maddox is no longer working for Sharps. Seems Elizabeth got sick of him screwing around and kicked him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kicked him out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Heywood doesn't seem to like the idea of employing an ex- son-in-law. So he's gone. So's Alison Olsen. Sidney stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: CLAYTON HARDING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't worry about Maddox. He's already lined up something with Gotham Magazine. I'm gonna need someone to hold the fort at I Spy. Strictly on a temporary basis, you understand? One more thing. Eleanor Johnson rang this morning, wondering if you'd like to write a profile on Vincent Lepak. Sidney stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: CLAYTON HARDING, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't know how you did it but somehow you've made it into the next room. 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the opening of Pretty Vacant by the Sex Pistols a we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the song continues we see Sidney interviewing Vincent, complete with shades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent is wearing a crown, being photographed on a thron Sidney and Eleanor are watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleanor is going through Sidney's copy, crossing lines ou with a red pen. Sidney watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney, Eleanor and a Photo-Editor are looking at the photos from the shoot. Eleanor is pointing out a blemish Vincent's face.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: ...as we watch the blemish disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney buys a copy of Sharps and flicks through it until finds what he's looking for - a four page feature entitle Vincent Lepak - Long Live The King. He stares at his byline at the top of the feature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elegant apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is being shown around a chic apartment by a Realto 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is amongst the room full of writers and editors, pitching to Clayton who nods approval and passes on to th next item.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney and Eleanor are talking with an ACTOR. Sidney is wearing a smart suit, fawning in a suitably restrained manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is interviewing the Actor, laughing sycophanticall at something he has just said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney sits at his desk, looking very much the part now i another expensive suit, talking on the phone. His desk is crowded with MUFFIN BASKETS. A COURIER is handing over a GIFT-WRAPPED BOX to him. Sidney opens the box to reveal a ROLEX SEA-DWELLER 4000 WATCH. Sidney stares at the watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is drinking champagne amongst the Glitterati, talking to a Producer. Simon Cowell walks past and high- fives him. Sidney throws back his head, laughing at something the Producer said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney sits in the steam room, wrapped in a towel, sweating. Slowly the steam envelops him until he has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON SIDNEY'S PHOTOGRAPH - looking as cool as he can. Alison sits alone reading Sharps, staring at Sidney's pho in the "Notes on Contributors" page. She smiles, then glances up, her smile fading. Maddox is walking towards her, drunk and sour faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (noticing the magazine) Well, well...little Sidalee. I feel like a proud Papa.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE MADDOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, I can't stay. Anderson wants me to go to some photographers exhibition. Hot new talent blah, blah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. (Beat) How hot is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new talent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you could drop the little wife routine? It's kind of in bad taste. Alison stares at him sadly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you're right.(Quietly) What goes around comes around. Maddox is about to say something but changes his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you back home. He is about to leave when he notices Alison's notebook on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And will you stop carrying that thing around with you? It's kind of embarrassing. He walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is with Eleanor and Sophie, who now looks every in the movie star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie's going to get a Golden Globe nomination for best actress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That's fantastic.(Beat) But...the nominations haven't been announced yet? 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is correct so we have absolutely no way of knowing whether or not she will be nominated. (Beat) So, if she is nominated we want Sharps to do a feature. Someone to cover the whole lead up, unrestricted access, the trajectory, the building of this unique brand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have a logo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the deal. Sophie wants you to do it. Sidney stares at her and then at Sophie, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can be my bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, Sidney. This is a cover story. I think a little celebration is in order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow falls. Sidney climbs out of a limousine with Eleanor and Sophie. The women breeze past the Doorman and into the club. Sidn hesitates on the thresh-hold, staring up at the sign abov him as if it's a magic portal. Sidney walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A surprisingly small, ultra A-list club, chic and ironic Christmas decorations. Sidney walks past celebrities and beautiful people. He's arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney stands with Kevin Bacon playing Six Degrees of Kev Bacon. People stand around watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, uh...Clark Gable. Go! 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark Gable to Vivien Leigh (Gone With The Wind), Vivien Leigh to Marlon Brando (Street Car Named Desire), Marlon Brando to Robert DeNiro (The Score) Robert De Niro to Kevin Bacon (Sleepers)! The crowd cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very drunk Sidney stands in a toilet cubicle with a YOU ACTRESS doing coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sexiest philosopher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, tricky, but I'm gonna say Nietzsche. Huge moustache. The Tom Selleck of Nihilism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...most evil philosopher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Good. Evil genius philosopher...Hobbes, proto-Nazi, Heidegger - actual Nazi, Hegel - twat. Basically your H's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most Hollywood philosopher?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...Bishop Berkely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esse est percipi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they `aint looking at you, you don't really exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh honey, tell me something I don't know... Sidney stoops and snorts a line of coke. 103.

dialogues.speaker: CIRCLE BAR
dialogues.text: Sidney, giddy on champagne, coke and success is dancing with Sophie. He's at the centre of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorbell rings. Sidney wearing a silk dressing gown wanders through the room from the bedroom and opens the door. Alison stands outside, smiling at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. It was a gift. Ralph Lauren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph Lauren. I did a piece. Beat. He still hasn't invited her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say I heard about you getting the promotion. Congratulations. I'm happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. How's things with you and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Fine. Everything's ...uh...I'm working for this little literary magazine. It's not the New Yorker but... (awkward) So, I've left you a bunch of messages...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I've been pretty busy. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought so. Alison stands awkwardly for a moment, smiling, then turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the novel coming along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well...still working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...keep at it. I believe in you. Alison smiles, touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never gave you these. He takes some papers from a shelf and hands them to her. Alison looks at them - the are titled "Notes On Alison's Novel." There's a LOT OF THEM. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney? Alison looks past Sidney to the bedroom door where INGRID the Fashionista stands in her underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little wave) Hey, Alice. Sidney looks at her and back at Alison. He gives a little laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half joking, half

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did it all go so wrong? Alison smiles, gives a little wave and walks away - befor he can see how upset she is. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie and her entourage, including Sidney and Eleanor, climb out of a line of limousines and walk into the Hotel Sidney stands for a moment, looking around him. Hollywood He's finally here. We hear the opening of Virgina Plain by Roxy Music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are swooping in towards the hotel and an enormous BILLBOARD ADVERTISEMENT for Sophie's new film - in pre- production. It's a re-make of Singing In The Rain - with Russel Crowe. We BOOM down from Sophie's fifteen foot laughing face to find Sidney standing on a slim ledge outside his hotel window. He is drunk and wearing only his underwear. He is also yelling with fear. The window behind him is crowded with people shrieking wi laughter. Gingerly he edges back to the window and climbs back into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a wild party. Music is blaring, people are dancing, drinking, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let me down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too high! You couldn't do it. Too high. Sophie calmly unzips her dress and steps out of it, standing in her underwear. There is applause from the on- lookers. Calmly she steps out of the window onto the ledg and disappears from sight. The on-lookers crane out of the window, yelling encouragement. After a moment Sophie appears at another window further along the wall and climbs back into the room to ecstatic applause. She stares imperiously at Sidney. 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your limpy pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your limpy pig!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right! Okay, limpy pig. You need to pay a forfeit. Whatcha got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got my little limpy dance. Sidney dances a little, jiggling up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your ring. Sidney stops dancing, his smile fading a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the ring. I want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. Sophie stares at him through narrowed eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, give me the ring and if I win tomorrow, I'll let you have sex with me. The on-lookers shriek with delight. Sidney stares at her. He looks past her to his reflection in the window - a drunk man in his underwear, swaying fro side to side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is back in his own room, alone, a mess. He sits on the floor chopping lines of coke on the coffee table. He stares groggily at the space on his finger where his ring used to be. 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering to himself) You're a star. You're a big, bright shining star... He snorts a line and, leaning back, flicks blankly throug TV channels - a sports programme, a news station, a sit-c re-run... He snorts another line, flicks stations - more sports, a music video, a black and white movie... Sidney stops, staring at the screen... TV SCREEN - we're watching the fifties British movie we s at the beginning of the film. Sidney's MOTHER is typing a the desk in the background. She gets up from the desk and walks into another office. Sidney stares, frozen. Sidney's mother passes the LEAD ACTRESS who is staring ou of the window, smoking. She stares at her sympathetically

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Celia Johnson accent) Don't worry Mary...you'll meet him one day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will I know when I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, when you meet the One, you'll know... She walks on. Sidney stares at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A conveyor belt of limousines arriving outside the Hilton Rain falls. Celebrities wave to the watching crowds as th make their way up the red carpet, cameras flash... Sophie emerges from a limo, looking amazing. SHE IS WEARI A FUR WRAP. She makes her way up the carpet, Sidney walks behind, smiling vaguely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various celebrities are being interviewed. Sidney stands little apart, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well... Look at you... 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence Maddox stands beside him, something nervous in h manner now, the old confidence gone. He has been drinking

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE MADDOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Made it all the way to the Seventh Room. He holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE MADDOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Congratulations. The wheel of fortune right? You go up, I go down. You're here with Sophie? How about doing your old Rabbi a favour and putting in a good word for me? Maybe a little interview? Sidney absent-mindedly takes his hand, looking past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Alison here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison? No, we went our separate ways. Actually she left me. Tells me she's in love with someone else. Sidney stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE MADDOX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nope, not you I'm afraid Sidalee. She threw us both over. Some guy named Clark. I mean...Clark. Can you believe it? But these are the sacrifices we make, right? I don't need to tell you. It's not a vacation. It's a vocation. So listen, about Sophie... But Sidney is no longer listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION - we move in on Sidney, sitting at the table, listening to the Best Actress award. This is where we fir met him.

dialogues.speaker: SIDNEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is me at the Golden Globes. That's my Armani tuxedo. That's a Rolex Sea-Dweller 4000 watch I'm wearing. I'm inside. I'm at the centre of everything. I'm right where I wanted to be. Beside him Sophie covers her face with her hands and star to stand, having just won Best Actress. 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney stares at her hands - she is wearing his gold ring We move back into real time, sound swells up, thunderous applause. Sidney claps along with the others. Then he stands up and goes after Sophie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking her arm) I need my ring back. Sophie turns back to him, her smile fixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need my ring back. As if puzzled by her inability to make it to the stage, Sophie, still smiling, tries to pull her arm free. Eleano is instantly beside them, trying to disengage Sidney's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling, hissing) What are you doing? Let her go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She isn't the One. My mother gave me that ring and told me I had to give it to the One. She isn't the One. The applause is still going strong. TV Cameras move in on Sophie as she starts to struggle, her smile slipping. Sidney tries to pull the ring free from her finger. Officials move in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just...Will you...I don't want to be on the inside. I don't want to be at the Party. I don't want to have have sex with you. (Beat) I

dialogues.speaker: KILLED CUBA
dialogues.text: Sophie stares at him for a moment then with a shriek launches herself at him. They tumble backwards. The Officials rush upon them. There are gasps from the other tables, people standing up to see what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs Kowalski sits watching the pandemonium on TV. 110.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIE MAES, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (on the TV) You fucking mother-fucking fucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soddom and Gomarrah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sharps Fashionistas are gathered watching the awards TV in silent horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophie kicks out at Sidney, ripping her dress in the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God no...not the Versace... Security pile on Sidney...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard Young sits watching the awards on TV. He gives a small smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alison sits watching on a TV in the corner of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: ELEANOR JOHNSON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (On TV - losing it) You're finished! You're finished! Alison begins to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney bursts free from the scrum of Security and begins run across the room, overturning a table in the process, Officials racing after him. Sidney sprints for the doors. He notices Vincent Lepak's startled face as he passes it. He stops, ducks back and slaps the back of Vincent's head, knocking the SHADES ont the floor. Sidney stamps on them and runs on. Vincent gap after him. 111.

dialogues.speaker: CLAYTON HARDING 146
dialogues.text: ...watching from his table as the people around him stand up to see the chase. He shakes his head in horror and the tries, and fails, to restrain a sudden bark of laughter..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney bursts out of the hotel onto the red carpet and is momentarily stopped by the sight of the massed PAPARAZZI  ahead, behind the red rope. The Paparazzi stare back at  Sidney - his face bruised, shirt collar ripped - equally  nonplussed. There is a frozen moment then Sidney plunges  forward, ducking under the red rope, back amongst his own kind, pushing through them until he disappears amongst th crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney stands at the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next available flight is ten am sir. Gets you into New York six thirty PM. Sidney sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney sits in the almost deserted terminal waiting for t flight back to New York. He is still wearing his dishevelled tux. He looks down at his tightly clenched ha and slowly opens his fingers to reveal his RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sidney is in a cab, still wearing his tux, his travel bag slung over shoulder. He stares out as the cab passes the entrance to a PARK. A sign advertises an outdoor screenin of La Dolce Vita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An outdoor CINEMA has been set up. LA DOLCE VITA is playi on a large screen. A crowd sits around the park, watching the movie. Sidney stands scanning the crowd. He locates Alison sitti near the back. 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is holding her notebook, watching the movie. Beside h is the remains of a picnic, with lit candles. Sidney smiles and starts towards her, then stops. She is sitting next to a MAN. As Sidney watches she rests her he on his shoulder. Sidney watches, numb, then turns to walk away... BOB stands in front of him in full drag, waving frantically. He starts to run towards Sidney, who sighs a closes his eyes - as if things weren't bad enough. Then Bob runs straight past him. Sidney turns to see the Man next to Alison standing up to embrace Bob. The two kiss.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GRASS
dialogues.text: Alison watches Bob and her friend embrace with a touch of sadness. Suddenly she realises someone is standing beside her. She looks up and sees Sidney. She stares at him. Long Beat. Sidney holds out his hand. Alison hesitates and then takes his hand and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the novel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finished. Sidney smiles. He takes the notebook from her and tosses back onto the picnic blanket. Then he kisses her. As he does so he takes the RING and slips it into Alison's coat pocket. Then they begin to dance, cha-cha-chaaing happily at the back of the park, as the music swells, lit by the flickering light from the screen. Suddenly Sidney freezes, staring over Alison's shoulder t where we can see he has accidentally thrown her NOTEBOOK onto a lit candle. It is now ON FIRE. Sidney shoves Alison aside and dives for the book...
